channel.title: [PI] Noob's guide to adjusting thieving!
channel.description:
Difficulty: 2/10 Download Link: Will post later, mediafire is being a bitch
Hey guys, It's Alister. This is my first post to this forum and I'm new soo.. yeah (: So we're going to be fixing the Ardougne thieving stalls today, and I'm going to be teaching you how to do it. So you can start by opening up your Source file and searching "actionhandler.java" After you open it, then you search (CTRL + F) "thieving" and something like this should pop up: [IMG]http://i1136.photobucket.com/albums/n497/Alister777/actionh.png[/img]
So now I'm going to explain what this stuff means: [IMG]http://i1136.photobucket.com/albums/n497/Alister777/explaining.png[/img]
Case 4874: "4874" is the Stall ID which the person will be stealing from. Feel free to modify to your likings. 1897: "1897" is the Item ID which the person will be stealing. Feel free to modify 10: "10" Is the amount of EXP the person will gain from stealing from the stall. Feel free to modify 1: "1" is the level required to actually steal from the stall. Feel free to modify So we're going to be fixing/making these stalls (in order): Gem stall Fur stall (You have to stand behind it to thieve from it) Spice stall (You have to stand behind it it thieve from it) Silk stall Baker's stall (You have to stand behind it to thieve from it) Silver stall
Now click below one of the top ones, and paste these codes into there :)
[code] case 2562: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1611, 120, 80); break; case 2563: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(948, 100, 75); break; case 2564: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(2169, 90, 70); break; case 2560: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(950, 90, 70); break; case 2561: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(7542, 145, 85); break; case 2565: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1806, 185, 99); break;[/code] If it looks a little out of place, adjust it by using TAB and Enter keys.
So now it should look a little like this: [IMG]http://i1136.photobucket.com/albums/n497/Alister777/final.png[/img]
So that's about it! Like I said, some of them, you have to either stand directly in front or back. [size=24pt]NOTICE: I found this on my computer from a while back on another forum. I guess I meant to post it but forgot. Anyway, If I f*cked something up, lemme know please x)[/size]

item.title: [PI] Noob's guide to adjusting thieving!
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:2, topic:437124”]You should go more in-depth and talk about actually re-doing it, rather then simplistic edits.

An enum with percentages for random rewards would be an interesting feature to add.[/quote]
^indeed

OP what you just did is just adding a few cases more, everyone with any bit of common sense could do that.
You should rewrite it to improve.

Gj on actually explaining though

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Noob's guide to adjusting thieving!
item.dc:creator: @Itz_Alister_Yo Itz Alister Yo
item.description:
@Itz_Alister_Yo wrote:

Difficulty: 2/10
Download Link: Will post later, mediafire is being a bitch

Hey guys, It’s Alister. This is my first post to this forum and I’m new soo… yeah (:
So we’re going to be fixing the Ardougne thieving stalls today, and I’m going to be teaching you how to do it. So you can start by opening up your Source file and searching “actionhandler.java” After you open it, then you search (CTRL + F) “thieving” and something like this should pop up:

actionh.png1024×736

So now I’m going to explain what this stuff means:

Case 4874: “4874” is the Stall ID which the person will be stealing from. Feel free to modify to your likings.
1897: “1897” is the Item ID which the person will be stealing. Feel free to modify
10: “10” Is the amount of EXP the person will gain from stealing from the stall. Feel free to modify
1: “1” is the level required to actually steal from the stall. Feel free to modify
So we’re going to be fixing/making these stalls (in order):
Gem stall
Fur stall (You have to stand behind it to thieve from it)
Spice stall (You have to stand behind it it thieve from it)
Silk stall
Baker’s stall (You have to stand behind it to thieve from it)
Silver stall

Now click below one of the top ones, and paste these codes into there

case 2562: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1611, 120, 80); break; case 2563: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(948, 100, 75); break; case 2564: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(2169, 90, 70); break; case 2560: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(950, 90, 70); break; case 2561: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(7542, 145, 85); break; case 2565: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1806, 185, 99); break;
If it looks a little out of place, adjust it by using TAB and Enter keys.

So now it should look a little like this:

final.png1024×736

So that’s about it! Like I said, some of them, you have to either stand directly in front or back. [size=24pt]NOTICE: I found this on my computer from a while back on another forum. I guess I meant to post it but forgot. Anyway, If I f*cked something up, lemme know please x)[/size]

Read full topic
